article.description:
Jason Terry scored 30 points and Shareef
Abdur-Rahim added 27 as the Atlanta Hawks snapped a six-game losing
streak Saturday night with a 101-94 victory over the Los Angeles
Clippers.
article.headline: Clippers struggle again on road, fall to Hawks
article.linkText: Terry makes sure Hawks end losing slide
article.story:
ATLANTA (AP) -- Jason Terry had a big night offensively, but he wanted to talk more about the Atlanta Hawks defense following a rare victory. Terry scored 30 points, and Shareef Abdur-Rahim added 27 as the Atlanta Hawks snapped a six-game losing streak Saturday night with a 101-94 victory over the Los Angeles Clippers. The Hawks, who had lost 12 of 13, trailed by 13 points in the third quarter before rallying. Terry said it was Atlanta's defense -- which held the Clippers to six points over the last six minutes of the period -- that sparked the comeback. "It's no secret that defense has been our weakness all year long," Terry said. "When we've been able to stop people, we've had success. We have no problem scoring points, but on the defensive end, that's where all of our problems occur." The Clippers were coming off impressive road victories over Dallas and San Antonio at the start of a seven-game road trip. Eric Piatkowski scored 22 to lead Los Angeles, which was playing without Corey Maggette, Lamar Odom, and Keyon Dooling. "Losing this game takes something away from those two wins," Clippers coach Alvin Gentry said. "They are still great wins for us and could have been the start of a great, great road trip with a win here. We didn't get it done." Atlanta led 96-92 with a minute to play when Darius Miles missed a floater in the lane. The Hawks rebounded, and Jacque Vaughn was fouled with 34.4 seconds left. He made both free throws to put Atlanta ahead 98-92. The Hawks held off the Clippers in the last five minutes by making five of their last six field-goal attempts. Atlanta made 49 percent of its shots. "I've said all along we're not going to make excuses with Corey out or with Lamar out or with Keyon Dooling out," Gentry said. "We've got enough guys we can throw the basketball to, and we've got to play with those guys and win with those guys." Los Angeles shot 50 percent from the field in the first half and led 51-42, but the Clippers made just 38 percent of their shots in the fourth quarter against the NBA's worst defensive team (101 points allowed per game). "We're going to have to find a way to stop doing this," Piatkowski said. "We beat the tough teams, and the games we should win are the games we are losing. We're not putting teams away." The Clippers led 63-50 in the third quarter and looked like they might win in a rout, but Abdur-Rahim scored nine points in a 17-2 spurt. Atlanta went ahead for good 67-65 with 2:58 remaining in the third on Terry's 3-pointer.

Game notes
Maggette did not play because of a strained left knee. Odom arrived in Atlanta after having an exam on his sprained right wrist. He is expected to miss another month. ... The Hawks have a seven-game home winning streak against the Clippers.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.
